context_of_use: The customer interacts with the online shopping system to manage their shopping cart.
description: Enable customers to add, update, and remove products in their shopping cart prior to purchase.
triggering_event: Customer decides to add a product to the cart.
preconditions: Customer is logged into their account.
postconditions: Products are successfully added to the cart.
Cart reflects the updated list of products.
assumptions: Customer has selected products to add to the cart.
requirements_met: The system allows adding products to the cart.
The system allows updating the cart.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects a product → System adds the product to the cart.
2. Customer views the cart → System displays the current items in the cart.
3. Customer updates the quantity of a product → System updates the cart with the new quantity.
4. Customer removes a product from the cart → System removes the product from the cart.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): Customer attempts to add an out-of-stock product → System displays an out-of-stock message.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): Customer views an empty cart → System displays a message indicating the cart is empty.
information_for_steps: 1. Product details including name, price, and availability.
2. Current items in the cart with their quantities.
3. Updated quantity and total price of the cart.
